alert.note: Alert for Morehouse (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 13 at 12:12AM CDT until April 13 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM CDT FOR MOREHOUSE...RICHLAND...WEST CARROLL AND FRANKLIN PARISHES... At 1212 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Berlin to near Goodwill to 6 miles northwest of Warden to Rayville to near Mangham to near Liddieville to Columbia, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Goodwill and Warden around 1220 AM CDT. Holly Ridge, Jones and Darnell around 1225 AM CDT. Winnsboro, Oak Grove and Crowville around 1230 AM CDT. Delhi and Bakers around 1235 AM CDT. Jigger around 1240 AM CDT. Wisner around 1245 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Baskin, Mer Rouge, Pioneer, Gilbert, Kilbourne, Forest, Bonita, Oak Ridge, Epps and Collinston. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for southeastern Arkansas...and northeastern Louisiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
